Questions.Question: Who said 'Courage is not the absence of fear, but the triumph over it'?
Questions.Explanation: Nelson Mandela, the South African anti-apartheid revolutionary and political leader, emphasized the triumph over fear in his influential quote.

Questions.Question: Which legendary Queen said 'I am not afraid... I was born to do this.'?
Questions.Explanation: Joan of Arc, a French heroine of the Hundred Years' War, made this statement before leading the French army to victory.

Questions.Question: Who authored the phrase 'Courage is grace under pressure'?
Questions.Explanation: Ernest Hemingway, the renowned novelist and Nobel Prize winner, connected courage with composure during challenging situations.

Questions.Question: Which famous leader proclaimed 'I have nothing to offer but blood, toil, tears and sweat'?
Questions.Explanation: Winston Churchill, the British Prime Minister during World War II, inspired the nation with this resolute declaration.

Questions.Question: Who declared 'The only thing we have to fear is fear itself'?
Questions.Explanation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, the 32nd President of the United States, uplifted Americans during a time of economic hardship.

Questions.Question: Which famous author wrote 'Courage is not the absence of fear, but rather the judgment that something else is more important'?
Questions.Explanation: Ambrose Redmoon, an American author and philosopher, provided a profound perspective on the nature of courage.

Questions.Question: Who stated 'Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage'?
Questions.Explanation: Lao Tzu, the ancient Chinese philosopher and writer, emphasized the empowering nature of love and courage.

Questions.Question: Which iconic American said 'Heroism doesn't always happen in a burst of glory. Sometimes small triumphs and large hearts change the course of history'?
Questions.Explanation: Mary Roach, a contemporary American author, highlighted the significance of humble heroism shaping the world.

Questions.Question: Who penned the words 'Freedom lies in being bold'?
Questions.Explanation: Robert Frost, a celebrated American poet, advocated for embracing boldness as a pathway to freedom.

Questions.Question: Who declared 'Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage'?
Questions.Explanation: Anais Nin, an influential diarist and writer, expressed the profound impact courage has on the experience of life.

Questions.Question: Who voiced 'Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear'?
Questions.Explanation: Mark Twain, the renowned American author, emphasized the notion of courage as the triumph over fear.

Questions.Question: Which acclaimed philosopher proclaimed 'Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others'?
Questions.Explanation: Aristotle, the ancient Greek philosopher, highlighted courage as the foundation for developing other virtues.

Questions.Question: Who stated 'Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen'?
Questions.Explanation: Winston Churchill recognized the multifaceted nature of courage in both speaking out and extending genuine attentiveness.

Questions.Question: Who proclaimed 'Courage, dear heart' in a classic fantasy novel?
Questions.Explanation: C.S. Lewis, in 'The Chronicles of Narnia', penned these words to inspire bravery and resilience in his enchanting narrative.

Questions.Question: Who declared 'Courage is not having the strength to go on; it is going on when you don't have the strength'?
Questions.Explanation: Theodore Roosevelt, the 26th President of the United States, emphasized the endurance and fortitude inherent in courage.

Questions.Question: Who said 'Courage is found in unlikely places' in a beloved fantasy literature series?
Questions.Explanation: J.R.R. Tolkien, in 'The Lord of the Rings', conveyed the discovery of courage within unexpected individuals and circumstances.

Questions.Question: Which iconic leader declared 'Courage requires the strength of mind'?
Questions.Explanation: Martin Luther King Jr., a prominent figure in the American civil rights movement, emphasized the importance of mental fortitude in acts of courage.

Questions.Question: Who voiced 'Bravery is the capacity to perform properly even when scared half to death'?
Questions.Explanation: Omar N. Bradley, a distinguished American general, articulated the essence of bravery in executing duties despite fear.

Questions.Question: Who articulated 'Courage is knowing what not to fear' in a philosophical work?
Questions.Explanation: Plato, the ancient Greek philosopher, discussed the discernment involved in courage by understanding what is truly consequential.

Questions.Question: Who expressed 'Bravery is the solution to regret' in a bestselling novel?
Questions.Explanation: John Green, in 'The Fault in Our Stars', conveyed the transformative power of bravery in overcoming lamentation and remorse.
